p: The arbidol molecule has a broad-spectrum antiviral activity and it inhibits the critical steps of interactions between the host cell and the virus. It acts directly on the virus modifying various stages of the viral life cycle, including cell binding, internalization and replication. Arbidol unites to lipid and protein residues suppressing the entrance of the virus entry and its fusion, budding, replication, assembly and viral resistance [ 70].
